metadata.title: USN-5610-1 -- rust-regex vulnerability
metadata.description: Addison Crump discovered that rust-regex did not properly limit the complexity of the regular expressions (regex) it parses. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5610-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  librust-regex+unicode-age-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+perf-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+perf-literal-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-segment-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-bool-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+aho-corasick-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-script-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-gencat-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-perl-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+memchr-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+default-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 librust-regex+unicode-case-dev - 1.5.4-1ubuntu0.1 No subscription required
